Articles.Content: Well I just came back due to the new release!The thing is though when I try to open the debug menu using alt+f12 it changes my brightness( i have a windows 8 computer).I tried using the Fn key because it had the same color of f12(xD)but had no luck...I usually like to go into career mode to max out my science,etc so I can still collect samples and stuff while having everything I want...Thanks!

Please check your settings.cfg to see what the debug menu is bound to, but I think you'll have to rebind it as this sounds like an operating system setting, not a KSP issue, so without knowing anything about your computer there's not much we can do for you.

You may need to remap your keyboard, KSP could be capturing the Fn key.

(I just realized I don't have one...ah, PC keyboards)

Why do laptops put those stupid things on anyway, nobody uses them. Save the F11!

> 
> You may need to remap your keyboard, KSP could be capturing the Fn key.
> (I just realized I don't have one...ah, PC keyboards)
> 
> 
> 
> Why do laptops put those stupid things on anyway, nobody uses them. Save the F11!

Actually I have a laptop!(Very fast Windows 8 though:3)And I think I tried Fn idk.

> 
> Well I just came back due to the new release!The thing is though when I try to open the debug menu using alt+f12 it changes my brightness( i have a windows 8 computer).I tried using the Fn key because it had the same color of f12(xD)but had no luck...I usually like to go into career mode to max out my science,etc so I can still collect samples and stuff while having everything I want...Thanks!

you can max out your science just by going into the game directory going into the saves folder and then into the game you want and edit the persistence.cfg file with absurd amounts of science
If you have a laptop make sure that fun lock is turned off (or on I'm not sure, if it's one and your brightness is changing change fn lock to the other state)
